Token.Abstract: The PPHPaymentProcessor is your one stop shop for turning various events into real money movement for your merchants. It supports card swipes, manually entered card data, chip and pin, and checkin/tab based transactions.
Issue a refund against a previously successful PayPal transaction.

Parameter.Name: transactionId
Parameter.Abstract: The transaction identifier for the original payment transaction

Parameter.Name: amountOrNil
Parameter.Abstract: Only pass an amount in the case of a partial refund. Otherwise, the backend will ensure it's a full refund.

Parameter.Name: completionHandler
Parameter.Abstract: called when the action has completed

Token.Abstract: Capture funds against an open checkin from PPHLocalManager and PPHLocationWatcher

Parameter.Name: checkin
Parameter.Abstract: information about the checkin (only id is needed)

Parameter.Name: invoice
Parameter.Abstract: the invoice on which to collect funds (total, currency, invoiceId are the main elements). You must save this invoice before attempting to collect payment.

Parameter.Name: completionHandler
Parameter.Abstract: called when the action has completed

Token.Abstract: Authorize a chip and pin card after pin has been validated

Parameter.Name: auth
Parameter.Abstract: from PPHCardReaderManager auth event.

Parameter.Name: invoice
Parameter.Abstract: the invoice on which to collect funds (total, currency, invoiceId are the main elements). You must save this invoice before attempting to collect payment.

Parameter.Name: completionHandler
Parameter.Abstract: called when the action has completed

Token.Abstract: Collect funds against a card that has been passed through a reader and for which magstripe data is available.

Parameter.Name: card
Parameter.Abstract: from PPCardReaderManager swipe event

Parameter.Name: invoice
Parameter.Abstract: the invoice on which to collect funds (total, currency, invoiceId are the main elements). You must save this invoice before attempting to collect payment.

Parameter.Name: signature
Parameter.Abstract: the buyer-generated signature, or nil for no signature. If signature is nil, a signature should be provided later with provideSignature:forTransaction:andInvoice:completionHandler:

Parameter.Name: completionHandler
Parameter.Abstract: called when the action has completed

Token.Abstract: Authorize funds against a card that has been passed through a reader and for which magstripe data is available.

Parameter.Name: card
Parameter.Abstract: from PPCardReaderManager swipe event

Parameter.Name: invoice
Parameter.Abstract: the invoice on which to collect funds (total, currency, invoiceId are the main elements). You must save this invoice before attempting to collect payment.

Parameter.Name: completionHandler
Parameter.Abstract: called when the action has completed

Parameter.Name: signature
Parameter.Abstract: the buyer-generated signature, or nil for no signature. If signature is nil, a signature should be provided later with provideSignature:forTransaction:andInvoice:completionHandler:

Token.Abstract: Collect funds against a card that has been manually entered.

Parameter.Name: card
Parameter.Abstract: Filled out manually or via a Card Scan

Parameter.Name: invoice
Parameter.Abstract: the invoice on which to collect funds (total, currency, invoiceId are the main elements). You must save this invoice before attempting to collect payment.

Parameter.Name: completionHandler
Parameter.Abstract: called when the action has completed

Token.Abstract: Mark an invoice as having been paid by an external payment type such as Cash or Check.

Parameter.Name: paymentType
Parameter.Abstract: must be cash or check currently for this method to succeed

Parameter.Name: note
Parameter.Abstract: a short note, such as the amount tendered or check number

Parameter.Name: invoice
Parameter.Abstract: the invoice on which to collect funds (total, currency, invoiceId are the main elements). You must save this invoice before attempting to collect payment.

Parameter.Name: completionHandler
Parameter.Abstract: called when the action has completed

Token.Abstract: Provide a signature record for a previously successful charge.

Parameter.Name: signature
Parameter.Abstract: the buyer-generated signature

Parameter.Name: response
Parameter.Abstract: the result of beginCardPresentChargeAttempt

Parameter.Name: invoice
Parameter.Abstract: the invoice of the transaction that's being signed for

Parameter.Name: completionHandler
Parameter.Abstract: called when the action has completed

Token.Abstract: Check if the given swipe data is for the same card that the invoice was paid with

Parameter.Name: card
Parameter.Abstract: the card data to be checked

Parameter.Name: invoice
Parameter.Abstract: the invoice against which to check the card

Parameter.Name: completionHandler
Parameter.Abstract: called when the action has completed

Token.Abstract: Check if the given chip+pin card data is for the same card that the invoice was paid with

Parameter.Name: auth
Parameter.Abstract: the chip+pin card data to be checked

Parameter.Name: invoice
Parameter.Abstract: the invoice against which to check the card

Parameter.Name: completionHandler
Parameter.Abstract: called when the action has completed

Token.Abstract: Check if the given event contains the same EMV data as the card that the invoice was paid with

Parameter.Name: event
Parameter.Abstract: the terminal decline event that contains EMV data

Parameter.Name: invoice
Parameter.Abstract: the invoice against which to check the card

Parameter.Name: completionHandler
Parameter.Abstract: called when the action has completed

Token.Abstract: Send the receipt for a particular transaction or transaction attempt/failure (in the EMV case) to an email address or mobile phone number.

Parameter.Name: payment
Parameter.Abstract: the response from the server for the payment attempt. In the case of successful non-EMV transactions, we only need the transactionId and paypalInvoiceId values of this object, so you can make one up with that data. For EMV, we need the transaction handle as well (e.g. from PPHChipAndPinAuthResponse

Parameter.Name: destination
Parameter.Abstract: the destination for the receipt (e.g. an email address or phone number)

Parameter.Name: completionHandler
Parameter.Abstract: called when the receipt is sent or an error occurs
